incidents.name: Video-Rtc-Services-Register Cannot Access dynamoDB

incident_updates.body: The Video Service’s connectivity issue with DynamoDB is operating normally at this time.

The Video Service’s connectivity issue with DynamoDB is now operating normally. Users should be able to use all Video functionality without errors. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

The Video Service’s connectivity issue with DynamoDB is now operating normally. Users should be able to use all Video functionality without errors. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

The Video Service’s connectivity issue with DynamoDB is now operating normally. Users should be able to use all Video functionality without errors. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently investigating an issue in which some video participants are unable to generate tokens correctly/ taking longer due to the video-rtc-services-register service’s inability to access dynamoDB. This impacts the production Twilio environment, affecting users attempting to join or establish video sessions through Video Rooms. While the service remains degraded but usable, affected participants may experience delays or failures when attempting to join video calls. The scope of customer impact depends on the percentage of requests currently failing and how long the dynamoDB access issue persists. Users should be advised that video functionality may be intermittently unavailable during this incident.  Our engineers are working to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently investigating an issue in which some video participants are unable to generate tokens correctly/ taking longer due to the video-rtc-services-register service’s inability to access dynamoDB. This impacts the production Twilio environment, affecting users attempting to join or establish video sessions through Video Rooms. While the service remains degraded but usable, affected participants may experience delays or failures when attempting to join video calls. The scope of customer impact depends on the percentage of requests currently failing and how long the dynamoDB access issue persists. Users should be advised that video functionality may be intermittently unavailable during this incident.  Our engineers are working to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently investigating an issue in which some video participants are unable to generate tokens correctly/ taking longer due to the video-rtc-services-register service’s inability to access dynamoDB. This impacts the production Twilio environment, affecting users attempting to join or establish video sessions through Video Rooms. While the service remains degraded but usable, affected participants may experience delays or failures when attempting to join video calls. The scope of customer impact depends on the percentage of requests currently failing and how long the dynamoDB access issue persists. Users should be advised that video functionality may be intermittently unavailable during this incident.  Our engineers are working to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently investigating an issue in which some video participants are unable to generate tokens correctly/ taking longer due to the video-rtc-services-register service’s inability to access dynamoDB. This impacts the production Twilio environment, affecting users attempting to join or establish video sessions through Video Rooms. While the service remains degraded but usable, affected participants may experience delays or failures when attempting to join video calls. The scope of customer impact depends on the percentage of requests currently failing and how long the dynamoDB access issue persists. Users should be advised that video functionality may be intermittently unavailable during this incident.  Our engineers are working to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Twilio Voice Calling Affected

incident_updates.body:
Twilio Voice API was degraded for 10 minutes minutes between 10:41 and 10:51 Pacific Time on 11/7/2025.
During this period of time, customers may have experienced failures when attempting to stop recordings and modify call APIs, which prevented users from managing active call sessions. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Inbound Calls From Carrier Peering Experiencing Drops in the United States

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We are seeing recovery of the issue with inbound calls from our Carrier Peering are being dropped due to missing RTP after our Engineers rolled back an update. Our engineering teams are monitoring this incident to ensure a full recovery. We will provide in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still investigating an issue where inbound calls from our Carrier Peering are being dropped due to missing RTP after an UPDATE. Twilio continues to send RTP, but our carrier is not receiving it, resulting in calls ending from the carrier side. This may cause dropped calls for customers using our Carrier Peering. Our engineering teams are actively working with our partners to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. We will provide in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still investigating an issue where inbound calls from our Carrier Peering are being dropped due to missing RTP after an UPDATE. Our engineering teams are actively working with our partners to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. We will provide in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Investigating Unexpected Account Closures

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

The issue where some customer accounts were being unexpectedly closed is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

The issue where some customer accounts were being unexpectedly closed is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

An issue where some customer accounts were being unexpectedly closed is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

An issue where some customer accounts were being unexpectedly closed is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to investigate an issue where some customer accounts are being unexpectedly closed. Impacted users may be unable to access their accounts, and recurring billable items may be deleted, which could affect business operations. Our team has identified the issue and is actively working on a resolution. We expect to provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently investigating an issue where some customer accounts are being unexpectedly closed. Impacted users may be unable to access their accounts, and recurring billable items may be deleted, which could affect business operations. Our team has identified the issue and is actively working on a resolution. We expect to provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently investigating an issue where some customer accounts are being unexpectedly closed. Impacted users may be unable to access their accounts, and recurring billable items may be deleted, which could affect business operations. Our team has identified the issue and is actively working on a resolution. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently investigating reports of unexpected customer account closures. The previous issue—where MFA resets led to user and account closures—has been resolved. However, affected users are still unable to create new accounts, and impacted accounts remain closed. Our team is actively working to determine the root cause and restore access to affected accounts as quickly as possible.
We expect to provide another update in 60 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our Account Portal is experiencing a partial outage related with reset 2FA causing user and account closures from the Console.
We are working to restore functionality as soon as possible. We expect to provide another update in 60 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.
